subject: Writing
title: Solzhenitsyn's Gulag Archipelago
description: A quick win: understand Solzhenitsyn's Gulag Archipelago.

hook.text: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn documented the Soviet prison system. The KGB seized his manuscript. He published it anyway.

buildup.text: The Gulag Archipelago described Soviet forced labor camp horrors from personal experience and eyewitness accounts.

discovery.text: The KGB found a hidden copy in 1973. Solzhenitsyn ordered his Paris publisher to release the full text immediately.

twist.text: The book's publication caused a global sensation and helped turn world opinion decisively against the Soviet system.

climax.text: Solzhenitsyn was expelled from the Soviet Union in 1974 â€” but his words stayed behind and kept working.

punchline.text: They exiled the author. They couldn't exile his truth.

quiz.question: What did Solzhenitsyn do when the KGB seized his manuscript?
options: Ordered his Paris publisher to release it immediately
Wrote a new version from memory
